title: Calories in Costco Muffins
meta_description: Discover calories in muffins from Costco, including macros, full nutrition breakdown per muffin, and variations for popular flavors like blueberry.
assumptions: Standard Costco bakery muffin (e.g., blueberry), large size (~200 g), baked fresh in-store, no additional toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by flavor, batch, size, and exact recipe; Costco values may differ—check in-store labels or app for precise info.

quick_answer.text: One Costco muffin has about 690 kcal, with high carbs from flour and sugar.

label_note: Values align with typical Nutrition Facts labels for easy reference and comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one Costco muffin?
faqs.a: Approximately 690 kcal for a standard large muffin.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in Costco muffins?
faqs.a: About 90 g carbs per muffin, mostly from refined flour and added sugars.

faqs.q: Do Costco muffins have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, around 50 g sugars per muffin, contributing to the high calorie count.

faqs.q: How does muffin flavor affect calories from Costco?
faqs.a: Flavors like chocolate chip may add 20–50 kcal; check specific labels.

faqs.q: Are Costco muffins high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 30 g total fat per muffin, including 5 g saturated fat from butter and oils.
